_header: For I am doughty of deed who so will me know
_description: On boasting about deeds, in a Latin sermon — one couplet

CULIi38.Transcription:
ffor I am dughti of dedewo so will me knowebe þe kyte may
                    seþe pecok & þe crowe
CULIi38.Note: Set forth in MS as a quatrain of short lines, abcb.
CULIi38.Editions:
Erb,  Peter C. 
             “Vernacular Material for Preaching in MS Camb. Univ. Lib.
                Ii.III.8.” 
             Mediaeval Studies
         33 (1971): 63-84: 76.
